channel.title: BBC News - Northern Ireland
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Aidan McAnespie: Former soldier to stand trial over 1988 killing
item.description: David Holden, 51, is accused of the manslaughter of Aidan McAnespie in County Tyrone.

item.title: Covid-19: Covid pressures 'putting cancer patients at risk'
item.description: A doctor sounds a warning as the virus is recorded on death certificates of 40 people in a week.

item.title: Hundreds of newly-qualified teachers not registered to teach in NI
item.description: About 500 new teachers are waiting to be fully registered and cannot be employed until then.

item.title: Covid-19: Swann sets target of 90% of NI jabbed for Covid-19
item.description: Having 90% of people in NI vaccinated would take pressure off the health service, says Robin Swann.

item.title: M1 crash: Six people taken to hospital after crash
item.description: Six people are taken to hospital after a collision on the motorway near Lisburn on Thursday night.

item.title: Child Funeral Fund: Money yet to be made available by Stormont
item.description: In England, Wales and Scotland the cost of a child's funeral is waived but no official scheme exists in NI.

item.title: Galway: Four dead after three-vehicle M6 collision
item.description: Police say all four people died at the scene of the three-vehicle collision on the M6.

item.title: Armagh makes bid for UK City of Culture
item.description: The council area is bidding for the 2025 title, which was previously awarded to Londonderry.

item.title: Newmills community helps to unearth history of former mill site
item.description: The residents of a Tyrone village help archaeologists to excavate the site of a former watermill.

item.title: Belfast fraudster who conned elderly while on bail avoids jail
item.description: Belfast man George Henry Patrick Crossett defrauded victims of more than Â£100,000, a court hears.

item.title: Londonderry: 'Traveller feud' accused granted bail
item.description: Four men and a teenager are granted bail after an incident at a filling station forecourt on Tuesday.

item.title: Translink late-night transport services back for Christmas
item.description: The extended services will support the hospitality industry leading up to Christmas, says Translink.

item.title: 'Urgent clarity needed' on football crowds' return
item.description: Northern Ireland Football League CEO Gerard Lawlor calls for "urgent clarity" from the Executive on the return of supporters to Irish Premiership matches this season.

item.title: Covid-19: Ulster University asks students about vaccine status
item.description: An anonymous survey on Covid-19 vaccines has been sent to UU's 27,000 students and 2,600 staff.

item.title: Covid-19: Schools can continue to teach some in class bubbles
item.description: It is despite the executive deciding earlier in August that schools no longer had to use bubbles.

item.title: Covid-19: Deaths and hospital admissions 'yet to peak'
item.description: A further 11 Covid-related deaths were recorded in Northern Ireland on Wednesday.

item.title: Covid vaccines still effective against Delta variant
item.description: But the jabs were more effective against the Alpha variant, the largest study of its kind suggests.

item.title: Covid-19: Relaxation of NI self-isolation comes in effect
item.description: Fully-vaccinated close contacts of people who have Covid-19 do not need to self-isolate from Monday.

item.title: Women's scheme to tackle paramilitarism in 'limbo'
item.description: The programme aims to give women the skills and confidence to help transform their communities.

item.title: Latest Northern Ireland weather forecast
item.description: The weather forecast in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Afghanistan: 'You fear for your family and friends at home'
item.description: Four people with links to the island of Ireland speak of their fears for relatives amid the chaos.

item.title: 'My sister's legacy is the Sibling Grief Club'
item.description: Sisters from County Tyrone started The Sibling Grief Club after their youngest sister died suddenly.

item.title: The day firebombs devastated Ballymena
item.description: BBC NI's political correspondent Stephen Walker recalls his hometown on a dark day in 1976.

item.title: A brief history of vaccination in Northern Ireland
item.description: With debates over human rights and Covid-19, BBC News NI looks back to a time when jabs were compulsory.

item.title: Bill Murray: Golf-loving Ghostbusters star given hand-forged putter
item.description: When the comedy star needed a new putter, who was he gonna call? A County Antrim blacksmith of course.

item.title: Afghanistan: UK must 'step up' for Afghans who helped war effort
item.description: DUP leader Sir Jeffrey Donaldson says Afghan staff who helped the Army should be offered sanctuary.

item.title: Long Covid: Health trust scheme helping staff get back to work
item.description: Monee Warwick returned to work as a childrenâs nurse six months after contracting Covid-19.

item.title: Afghanistan: 'You fear for your family and friends at home'
item.description: Muhammad Edrees, who lives in Londonderry, says he is fearful about his family back in Afghanistan.

item.title: Caravans destroyed in suspected arson attack in Racecourse Road
item.description: Police say they are investigating to try to find out the cause of the fire.

item.title: Six arrested after group fight in Buncrana Road, Derry
item.description: It was reported a group of men were fighting in the forecourt of a filling station in Buncrana Road.

item.title: Londonderry bonfire: Police investigate 'offensive material'
item.description: Police say a bonfire had banners making threats towards police officers and a member of the public.

item.title: Fermanagh man faces nine indecent assault charges
item.description: Gerard Quaile, 56, is the second person to be charged following a newspaper investigation.

item.title: Two men die in three-vehicle crash in County Meath
item.description: A man in his 40s and a man in his 30s die in a three-vehicle crash on the R152 at Keenogue.

item.title: Irish government to evacuate 36 citizens from Afghanistan
item.description: Three Irish citizens have been evacuated from the country so far, Ireland's foreign minister says.

item.title: Jack Woolley: Irish Olympian awaiting surgery after Dublin attack
item.description: Irish Olympian Jack Woolley is awaiting surgery after being violently attacked in Dublin on Friday night.

item.title: Irish Paralympian's wheelchair broken on plane
item.description: Irish Para-swimmer Patrick Flanagan's wheelchair is left "completely broken" following a flight to Heathrow en route to the Tokyo Games.

item.title: Limerick: Pair held on suspicion of boy's murder freed
item.description: The four-year-old child was fatally injured in a house in Limerick on 13 March.

item.title: Gerry Hutch arrested in Spain over boxing weigh-in gun attack
item.description: Gerry Hutch, known as "The Monk", is wanted over the 2016 gun attack at the Regency Airport Hotel.
